Amazing zombie killing co-op.

This game is awesome, it might be just another zombie wave shooter but the gunplay is probably the best i have ever seen. The guns feel have some weight to them and when you shoot you can see the power they have and hitting a zombie in the head with a gun is so satisfying. The guns have recoil and are not COD/BF like. The developers really went out of the way to make this shooter feel great to play and if they stick with this formula and the added zombie dismemberment they will have another like from me.

Oh boy.

This will be an in-depth review of the multiplayer game mechanics, including pros and cons.

Killing Floor is fun. It's easy to pick up, and easy to put down, which are simultaneously its best and worst qualities. You play a survivor of what I believe is a series of genetic experiments on humans (haven't played any of the story modes yet) hunting down the mutated freaks who come after you with everything from claws to rocket launchers. On the multiplayer, you can team up with people (generally 6 people on most servers, but I've seen servers with up to 25 players) and navigate through the various waves of zombies/mutants who are all trying to kill you, each zombie/mutant with their own distinct attacks, and some of them much tankier than others.

The player characters are "perk" based (think 'classes'), which each perk allowing the player various discounts at the in-game store for particular weapons (ie. sharpshooter perk gets discounts on pistols and rifles, firebug perk gets discounts on flamethrowers, as well as additional damage for the appropriate weapons). You can only have one perk at a time, but the way you play levels up various other perks, so if you're not sure which perk to go with, you'll be able to see which one you're most suited for based on your playstyle. As of now, you're only able to customize which survivor you're playing, and apply whatever perk you'd like to the character skin. 

There is a HUGE selection of guns and melee weapons, as well as launchers, ray guns, laser guns, grenades, and the occasional sword, as well as a healing item, a knife, a door-welding item, and a secondary weapon (all included in your initial loadout, regardless of your perk). An in-game store allows players to purchase new guns after each wave, with your cash income based on how well you're doing in the game. The higher-tier weapons aren't necessarily better than the lower tier, and you really have to figure out which guns work best for your playstyle. 

The last pro I'd like to talk about are the maps. The maps are absolutely incredible, and credit is to be given in full to the dev team. Some of them are vast, open arena-style maps, with enemies coming from every side, and your group (if they stuck together) dead center. Others are filled with corridors and doorways which can be welded, sealing it off from enemies (though they can break through after some damage). These maps with the corridors make it easier to funnel your enemies, but you always have to be watching your back. I've seen a few maps on the workshop, and they look fantastic, allowing for many different modifications to change the game up.

Those are all the pros. Now let's talk about the cons.

Killing Floor is frustrating. Upon death, regardless of which wave you're on, you will lose all purchased guns and begin again on the next wave with the initial loadout (healing item, knife, pistol, welder), and $250 (which is barely enough to get a new gun). The thing about this is that while any alive teammates are buffed, and can take out aggressors easily, you become pretty squishy, and not much help. This is a game mechanic, and not a broken one; just an annoying one. 

Not only that, but when the next wave begins, and you respawn, you're typically a good distance away from your team, and from the store, meaning that you're probably going to end up trying to defend whatever wave was next with some very crappy weapons. 

The Killing Floor online community ranges from skilled to ass-hatted. Though it is a survival game, and you think the best way to survive would be to stick together, players often disperse from the team to farm for better weapons. That's great for them, but meanwhile, the small party has gotten smaller, and is more susceptible. If you're going to play online, I'd recommend you play with friends, or people you know won't ditch the group in favor of themselves. 

Furthermore, there is a difficulty setting on servers. While this is an excellent feature, you're not able to see the difficulty of the server you're about to join from the menu, so if you're a new player, you could be joining a lobby on the hardest difficulty, which might leave you feeling absolutely useless. This can be very disheartening, and has caused one or two rage quits on my part.

Should you buy Killing Floor? If you like FPS games with waves of mobs similar to Left 4 Dead, Nazi Zombies (in CoD), or even Space Invaders, yes. It's a good game for a good price, and a lot of fun if you just want to kill some time by playing a game. Is it worth the price? If you have friends who can play with you, it is very much worth the price. It's hard to survive on a team that isn't communicating, and on the servers, there is very little communication. Still, it's a well-designed FPS, and will provide hours of entertainment.

Ein unglaublich geiles Game, selbst nach Jahren macht es echt viel spaß. Am besten sollte man es mit seinen Freunden spielen da es einfach mehr spaß macht als mit Fremden zu spielen. Es gibt unglaublich viele Community Maps/Waffenpacks und SpezialServern mit eigenen Ideen und Verbesserungen. Das einzig Negative ist das die Zombies leider IMMER an ihren Festgelegten Spawns spawnen was gerne unnötige Tode hervorholt, und die Standart Waffenauswahl ist leider ein bischen mager. Trotzdem ein Geiles Clan Game und macht fast alles Richtig.

Diese Review übernimmt keine Verantwortung für Rechtschreib/Grammatikfehler. ^^

This game is purely amazing! The game is about you and 5 other people trying to survive and fight off the oncoming horde of specimens. The specimens I guess could relate to zombies in a sense, for most of them are slow and looming towards you. There are other specimens, and some are extremely difficult and take technique to take down. The game adapts in difficulty as more players join, by giving the zeds (specimens) more health, and they appear in more drastic numbers. This makes the game challenging. There is not running away strategy, you need to stay and fight, which gives you a sense of peril or danger, knowing that many of the zeds could easily outrun you leading to your ultimate demise. The gun mechanics are very satisfying and the gore system works perfectly with it. You can pick one of (8) classes to use, each with different stats and weapons to act with the class. The game might not be the BEST game on steam, but it's certainly up there! Hope this helps with your next purchase!
Un jeu pour bien se defouler

Money money money.  This game is great for smaller LAN parties and late nights, and has yielded some of the most fun I've had in a cooperative, wave-based game.  Guns feel good, graphics and atmosphere is unique and enjoyable, and even people with older PC builds can run this game just fine, I ran it for awhile on a 5 year old laptop with integrated graphics and had no problem.
Fun game to play with friends co-op, killing zombies n' shit. Definitely grab it if you find it on sale.

Ещё есть прикольные скины персонажей и это очень прикольно ставлю лойс этой игре:)

Killing Floor is a fun game that has many pros but this does not mean that it is flawless.

Killing Floor is about you fighting a bunch of human experiments as one of classes. Each classes is varied enough that they are perfect for certain situations but they can still kick ass any other time. The guns and gameplay feels so satisfying that sometimes you want to play just so that you can score a headshot during  zed time (slo-mo). Thereis enough of a variety of enemies that you need to be on your toes at all times. 

Some problems with Killing Floor is with the community. There is enough trolls that you will run into at least one every couple of rounds. Some other problems come in the form of a non-existent plot that may take away some replay value. The voice acting is bad but in a good way. It is laughable and should not be taken seriously. There is a definite sense of repetition but it does not come on for a while.


TLDR: Even with it's flaws, you can't help but be entertained. It is a fun shooter.
